alert.note: Alert for Lamar (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 4:50PM CDT until July 09 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following county, Lamar. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Paris, Reno, Blossom, Roxton, Lake Crook, Lake Gibbons, Sumner, Camp Maxey, Powderly, Pat Mayse Lake, Pattonville, Forest Hill, Deport, Novice, Toco, Sun Valley, Atlas, Glory, Broadway Junction and Howland.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
